class_notes:
A continuation of Greek 101. We will continue our study of the basic grammar and syntax of classical Greek within its larger cultural context. Our focus will again be on attaining facility in reading; review of material of Greek 101 will be done as necessary. This semester we will read further selections from Aristophanes, comedies, extended selections from a speech of Demosthenes with importance for the study of women, law, and sexuality in antiquity, and brief selections from Plato, Euripides, and other major classical authors.
Text: JACT, Reading Greek, 2nd edition, Cambridge University Press (2 volumes)
JACT, Reading Greek: Text and Vocabulary (ISBN: 978-0-521-69851-1)
JACT, Reading Greek: Grammar and Exercises (ISBN: 978-0-521-69852-8)
Particulars: Frequent quizzes, hour exams, and a final. Students are expected to attend regularly and to prepare homework for most classes.
Prerequisite: Greek 101 or equivalent (consult the instructor with questions: lpratt@emory.edu)
course_description: Spring. Continuation of Greek 101. Further study of forms and syntax, followed by reading from one or more authors.
sections: Class Nbr: 3858, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MWF 8-9:15a, Instructor: L. Pratt, Status: Open
